file_content.text: I'm through with you and Gianna. Don't get me involved again.
I've covered my debt to Gianna. I don't want any other part of this.
Huh. You're the one Gianna recruited to rescue her son? She said you were on your way.
Look, I'll point out her husband, but that's it. He seems jumpy, and I'm not risking my neck.
Where's the man and the kid?
Point the way.
You're off the hook, just don't get in my way.
Fair enough.
I appreciate it. I really do.
Keep it to yourself.
Right. I think I get it.
Hey! Hey, Kendrel! Somebody wants to talk to you!
Do I know you? What do you want with me?
I'm here to take your son back so your wife can send him to Korriban.
I spoke to your wife.
I'm here to discuss sending your son to Korriban.
Just a little talk.
I'm here to take your son to Korriban... and to kill you if I have to.
We've got business together.
Your cooperation, or else.
Wait, what's all this about? You can't just come here and threat--my wife sent you, didn't she?
My wife is so determined for our son to become Sith that she hires a bully to threaten me.
Well, I'm not about to sacrifice Zi'am to those--those vicious dogs on Korriban.
It's an honor for your son to have this chance.
This is a good thing.
Honor? Do you even know what they do on Korriban?
Why not?
Those "dogs" hold the power in the Empire, and don't you forget it.
Don't insult the Empire.
I was once an acolyte at the Academy on Korriban. There's no failure at the Sith Academy. Those who can't cut it, die.
I got wise and fled before they could kill me, and I'll die before I see my son eaten alive by those Sith dogs!
I don't want to fight you.
You're right. You're right. We can make a deal, can't we?
I've heard from both you and your wife. I want to know what your son thinks about this.
What does your son want?
He wants to stay with his daddy--don't you, Zi'am?
Uh-huh!
So let's make a deal.
That can be arranged.
You may get your wish.
No, no, wait, wait. Let's talk this out.
Gianna doesn't care about me, but she won't rest until Zi'am's on Korriban.
Let me take my son and flee. Tell my wife that you persuaded me, and we took the shuttle to Korriban; she won't know any different.
Your son's going to Korriban and there's nothing you can do to change that.
No. [Kill him]
Ah! Damn it all....
You... dad....
Get back to your mother. Forget what you saw here, okay?
Better go home.
It had to be done.
One day, you'll thank me for this.
I did you a favor.
I'll... I'll go home now.
That was... nevermind. Not my business.
I'll tell Gianna you took your son to Korriban.
All right, I'll lie for you.
Oh, thank you. We'll leave right away, and you'll never hear from us again.
Sorry, I'll be with you after I clear these vessels for departure.
